solution_line_template: There are {total_layers} - {limestone_layers} = <<{total_layers}-{limestone_layers}={not_limestone}>>{not_limestone} layers of rock that are not limestone.

Half of those {not_limestone} are sandstone, so there are {not_limestone} / {sandstone_divisor} = <<{not_limestone}/{sandstone_divisor}={not_limestone_or_sandstone}>>{not_limestone_or_sandstone} that are not limestone or sandstone.

Four of those are quartz, so {not_limestone_or_sandstone} - {quartz_layers} = <<{not_limestone_or_sandstone}-{quartz_layers}={not_limestone_sandstone_quartz}>>{not_limestone_sandstone_quartz} layers are not limestone, sandstone, or quartz.

Half of the rest are shale, so {not_limestone_sandstone_quartz} / {shale_divisor} = <<{not_limestone_sandstone_quartz}/{shale_divisor}={kinds_one_layer}>>{kinds_one_layer} kinds of rock remain that make up only one layer in the strata.
